channel.title: A command called "::make". How do I make it work?
channel.description:
Well, after tying a bunch of random button pressing, I found a actual command called "::make" Well, what is it for? (and why isn't it in the help list of commands? IDK) But what dose it do, and how do I use it?
It says: "Use ::make #### #"
Anyone?

item.title: A command called "::make". How do I make it work?
item.dc:creator: @xstrxpurez xstrxpurez
item.description:
@xstrxpurez wrote:

No… you need to delete that client u got right now… download a new one that says open source on the post or title… then use the link i gave you… and you will be able to set of the JDK and stuff…

Read full topic
item.source: A command called "::make". How do I make it work?

item.title: A command called "::make". How do I make it work?
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“Dart Zamaki, post:14, topic:231655”]So, pretty much I have to make a server to be able to edit everything?[/quote]No, to edit anything. Download a server and a client. If you want to start off from somewhere, start off from http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/index.html. You’ll need to know how to code in java before you code in java(it sounds like common sense, but everyone tries to code servers and clients without java knowledge and ends up failing).

Read full topic

item.title: A command called "::make". How do I make it work?
item.dc:creator: @xstrxpurez xstrxpurez
item.description:
@xstrxpurez wrote:

ok well you need to get JDK 6u7 or anything to do with JDK6… then set environmental variables… to do this follow the link below

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

follow the steps… it will get u set up for a server and for the client stuff you need.

Read full topic

item.title: A command called "::make". How do I make it work?
item.dc:creator: @Dart_Zamaki Dart Zamaki
item.description:
@Dart_Zamaki wrote:

Well, I tried that, but they keep saying “server error” BUT BEFORE ANYTHING IS SAID, the original moparscape will work when I click “new server” (client offline) and play it, but for some reason I can’t get any of the others to work.

Read full topic

right now I AM ONLY using client side ONLY currently! Please don’t accuse me of anything!
(Besides, I know that is going to give me a H of a time trying to build a server.) But right now I am ONLY
wanting to learn all about moparscape before attempting to try to goto server side.[/quote]

download a open source client…

item.title: A command called "::make". How do I make it work?
item.dc:creator: @hasumon hasumon
item.description:
@hasumon wrote:

[quote=“tonypker13, post:6, topic:231655”][quote author=Dart Zamaki link=topic=305131.msg2445243#msg2445243 date=1221690951]
Ohh, well, speaking of which, I don’t have any “.java” files, only “.class” that I try editing, but when I put together, moparscape crashes. (Yea… Sorry if that sounded mean, but I wasn’t trying to. Just mad cause I can’t get it to work.)

But thx for the advice
[/quote]
How do you NOT have java files… Server.java is what runs a server…[/quote]
Its the class file the computer reads to do w-e it says on it nawrb.

Read full topic

Ohh, well, speaking of which, I don’t have any “.java” files, only “.class” that I try editing, but when I put together, moparscape crashes. (Yea… Sorry if that sounded mean, but I wasn’t trying to. Just mad cause I can’t get it to work.)

But thx for the advice

sounds to me like u leeched? or u have no clue how to code…
[/quote]Read his signature?hes new and has problems tbh hes prolly using a closed source?[/quote]

thats the reason he finds one that says open source tho… i insist that you use devo v7… its easy to code, stable, and its an ok source.
